caption: It would be a five, but my partner wasn't as impressed. They brought out our food together, but I think the timing was a little odd because his was cold. I absolutely love this place otherwise, their tiramisu is the best, as is the Parisian benedict!
So good! It's mine and my fiance's new favorite brunch spot.

Went with my husband had a great time! Hubby had an omelet with ham, onion, peppers, cheddar and a croissant delicious! I had the eggs benedict best I've ever had! The homemade sauce was out standing and was served on a croissant that was delicious. The service was fantastic!
A bright and delightful brunch restaurant. Eggs benedict on a croissant, what's not to love?
I’ve ordered delivery from Mon Ami a few times now and it has been fantastic every time. The food is just delicious.
Very good! High quality pastries and food. Well executed.
French toast and the Eggs Benedict! We got the benny without meat. It comes on a croissant with potatoes. I rarely review restaurants, but this is a must go.
(Translated by Google) V good croque madame  (Original) V good croque madame
The food was great and the staff is amazing. I spoke with the cook who made my food. I believe his name was Jordan. Very friendly and did a fantastic job cooking my food!
I give this spot a thumbs up. I'll return with my friends.
Hidden Gem, one of my favorites. Can't  wait to pandemic is over so I can invite relatives to brunch

AMAZING!!! Went to their soft opening for their dinner, and it was unbelievable! Food was amazing.. I got the burger and it was mouth watering. I loved the atmosphere, and the staff was great. Definitely recommend!

Mon Ami is wonderful. We discovered it while living downtown and we still drive back regularly. Everything on the breakfast menu is great. I measure a breakfast spot by the diner combo - the Americain Breakfast here. It's always consistent and delicious. The French press is perfect for getting the day started (good, strong coffee). Don't sleep on the pastries!  Also this is the only cafe I know of that has a legitimate big-city skyline type feel, with a giant window next to architectural treasures like Cathedral Park and the Guarantee Building.
My new favorite place!!! Great food, fantastic atmosphere.  The bakery items are divine!!!

Extremely disappointed with the attitude more than the service. Took 35 mins for a simple order of a sandwich that was made of stale bread. The Americano was cold.. Did not even bother to give cutlery. Poor experience. I understand it is tough to operate during the pandemic but these are basic things that cannot be overlooked..

Quick service, good ambiance, appropriate social distancing. Homemade super thin potato chips, so good. I did however ask for a glass of water and they said their tap was "broken" despite hearing multiple expresso's being made and dishes clinking in the washroom. I was offered the option of purchasing a bottle of water though😂😂 After spending $35 on two sandwiches, can't I have a glass of water??

Not my fave. My friend recommended it. My daughter like the french toast. The cookie wasnt fresh it was actually crunchy but soft in the middle the potatoes was good. The bacon was microwaved I believe wasnt bacon from the pack. The sausage didnt look done but the waitress reassured it was because it was pork sausage. The croissant was buttery and good. The egg was good. The fresh orange juice was good but small class for $4 not enough juice options they didnt have anymore apples for apple juice and they had apple cider which my daughter didnt like. I wouldn't say 1 star they are nice people. I wouldnt come back me personally. This is just my opinion and at the end I had to go up to the counter to ask for our cookie. U can tell it's really not a real sit down restaurant but they do bring the food to you if you wish to sit and eat.
Got there about two, it was not packed. I think I might become a regular. This place has a good design. Food is like a restaurant in Louisville I liked.
Great French Cafe & restaurant in the center of downtown!
Amazing hospitality, front of house staff was wonderful.

Great food and overall ambiance. Definitely recommend if you live downtown and need a place to eat and hang out for a little. Was able to park right next to the restaurant on Sunday so their location is very convenient. Closest thing you can get to a Toronto-like experience in Buffalo.
hands down best breakfast restaurant in Buffalo :)

I went to Mon Ami for the first time with a friend a few days ago and will definitely be back again! Its a bright, clean, and open space with welcoming and helpful staff. I decided to try the vegetable quiche with a side of tomato basil soup (vegetarian options!). It was delicious and very filling. My friend had the Parisien eggs Benedict with a side of potatoes which she loved. We couldn’t resist grabbing a box of macarons for dessert on our way out which were just as amazing as our entrées. Lovely experience and great prices!
Good food, sad service

Mon ami is one of the BEST places in buffalo!!! I took my mom there for her birthday a month ago and we both still sing praises about the restaurant! The food was delicious and plated beautifully, and the coffee is genuinely some of the best I’ve ever had. What was even better than the food was the service, even when they were busy the front of house was so so sweet and accommodating!! I recommend this place to everyone I meet and I can’t wait to eat there again! Definitely try the Parisian Eggs Benedict or the macaroons (which are made in house!!!!)💞💓💖

The food looked nice and if you like cold food your in luck!! The potatoes were hot and tasty when asked for them to be crispy.  The plate was warm. But the Parisian  Eggs Benedict came out cold and when we told them they asked if we wanted it reheated.....reheated eggs benedict???  So they remade it which was nice until it came out just a touch warmer than the last time....how can poached eggs come out almost cold and the meat & sauce cold too.   Hope we don't get sick.  I was really looking forward to going to this place....guess it's one and done!  The staff were lovely.
If there is zero star, I would put zero! Horrible service, disgusting food(
The food is very good and you have options to seat inside or out side, from the Hotel to this place you can walk

Worst meal ever. Ordered vegetable quiche with a side of lentil soup. Quiche was tasteless & couldn't even eat the soup,it was like eating thick spaghetti sauce with a few lentils. My husband ordered the chicken sandwich which he said was like shoe leather.
Amazing service and great food 🥘 !!! Five ⭐️

Staff is nice and efficient, they have outdoor sittings in a quiet street, the coffee is good and they have croissant/ pain au chocolat. They also offered a mask when we asked, which we really appreciated.
The food was cold the service slow the coffee gross. The people just talk to each other and don’t care for their customers. Need better management. Apparently the teens don’t know how to life.
Great food. Comfortable environment. A bit pricey, but worth it.

The food was very good, the experience less so. I don't know if was just a strange time, but our food took quite a bit longer than I would have figured. It didn't seem that busy, but who knows what was happening. Regardless, high quality food at a reasonable price so I'll try again and see if it was a one time thing.
Delicious!
Great breakfast place!  Friendly staff and excellent food!

Nice people, good service, delicious eggs Benedict served on a croissant with ham and bacon and a light slightly mustardy hollandaise sauce. 😋 The reason for 4 stars is I thought the coffee was very acidic. Nice ambiance. Street dining too.
Goats
Great breakfast and lunch spot in the heart of downtown Buffalo!
Such a wonderful addition to downtown and love treating myself to lunch here. Happy they were open for pick up and delivery during COVID. Everything I've tried so far has been incredible!
So yummy! That have the best breakfast bowl. Well everything is good, even lunch. Just try it, you won't be disappointed

Took 40 minutes to make a breakfast bowl and 2 croissants. They kept telling me 5 minutes. When I asked they told me they are busy and there was only one table in the restaurant. Came to find out they ran out of potatoes.

Mon Ami is such a great addition to downtown Buffalo! The brunch type menu offers both hearty and sweet combinations of crepes and omelets with sandwiches, breakfast bowls, and anything imaginable served on a crispy, fresh croissant. They give you choices of ingredients including gluten-free. They also have an extensive espresso menu; my caramel macchiato was perfect. The staff is very friendly and attentive, the person who took our order was Claudia. I had their Parisian Eggs Benedict which was done to perfection! I look forward to trying their croque madame next. I would definitely return.

Been here a few times. Staff seemed a bit disorganized the first time but maybe someone was new as the other times things went smoothly. The food is excellent for the price with a few good gluten free options.

Mon Ami is a quaint little cafe with a beautiful interior. Great location for a bite to eat before an event downtown. They have a lot of choices on the menu including make your own omelets and crepes. The food is good and portion size is normal. One qualm is the menu may not list all of the toppings you will receive on your entree (the Chicken Parisien comes with lettuce and mayo as well) so be sure to ask the waiter just in case.
Great atmosphere! The big windows bring a lot of light in the room and provides a relaxing vibe!  Staff is very nice and food is really good!
Amazing tasting, authentic food. Will definitely be a repeat customer!
Very cute place that feels tucked away. Great for a breakfast date and the espresso was done right. I got the Parisian Eggs Benedict one time and was phenomenal. I will definitely be back soon.
Mon Ami? More like... Mi Amor!
Great place to meet. High quality good, just wish they would expand their menu so there's more to enjoy.
First of all, this place has a great vibe to it. Then, the menu is very cool. Sandwiches, soups, quiche etc.. All very fresh and delicious. Perfect lunch spot.
I've only had the desserts and they are incredible. I love the fruit tart!
This place is so cute and the prices are very reasonable. The food is phenomenal. I had the eggs Benedict and it was some of the best I've ever eaten. Parking can be tricky though!
Coffee was very good. Crepes and the gluten free labeling need some work. My friend had the egg benedict and loved it. I would return and recommend.
Nice ambiance and location, very romantic vibes, clean and elegant. The food was ok,  a bit pricey.
Very nice place to go!! I would say the best in buffalo or Even in NY state
Food & atmosphere are SUPER!!
Great atmosphere and the food is delicious. Great for lunch or breakfast.
Amazing food. Great coffee and they have macaroons!!!

Since discovering this gem we have become regulars! Consistently delicious, high quality food, mouthwatering pastries and friendly staff, combined with a chill vibe make this our ‘go to’ spot for breakfast or brunch. We SO appreciate the fact that we can enjoy a civilized meal without competing with other diners shouting at each other. A true European experience...
Delicious food, great prices, and really cool ambiance and decor.
Best coffee. Great food. Great French music in the background
(Translated by Google) Very cozy place with original kitchen  (Original) Очень уютное место с оригинальной кухней

Interesting food choices that are not run of the mill.  Lunch was very good. The cashier suggested Croque Madame, and I did enjoy it.  This restaurant is a cross between fast food and sit down.  You order and pay at the counter, sit down and they being the food to you on real plates and silverware.  Fresh food and no paper wrappers.

I came here for the first time and it was absolutely amazing. The food was wonderful, I enjoyed it a lot! Their homemade potato chips were delicious! Right down to the customer service, the environment and the ambiance of the entire place it was such an enjoyable experience. I highly recommend this place to everyone!
Nice Sunday brunch.....live music......great spot ...give it a try
Incredible place with delicious food and live music!
Quality fresh bakery
Great egg benedict. The ambient is great. Nice staff

Love love love this place. Fantastic sandwiches out of this world desserts and yummy home made chips. Everything I have tried has been delicious. So happy for a new restaurant for lunch downtown that isn't deep fried and slathered in grease

We came here for breakfast bc the reviews were good. But I would not recommend. Eggs were not good. Cold & also grayish. It was one big blob that I could pick up altogether. Fruit was partly ok, but why serve brown strawberries? It's very difficult to mess up breakfast, but they certainly did. Crepe also was disappointing. Coffee similarly not great. I left hungry bc I couldn't eat what they served. And had to get food elsewhere. So I'm not sure how they're getting such good reviews w this kind of food.
Croque Monsieur... what's NOT to love?

This hidden gem, is the place to be for breakfast/lunch. Especially, if you work downtown. Parking is always a difficult thing whenever you are downtown. But if you didn't take the train, you can find (paid)parking on some of the side streets. Mon Ami is a very spacious, well lit restaurant, with a wonderful view of the neighborhood. There is plenty of table seating as well as bar stool seating at the windows.  Today's visit was for the breakfast sandwich (egg,cheese,meat). The croissant was very soft and flaky, and had a nice amount of egg and bacon. I would've enjoyed it a little bit more, if there was more cheese to it. The side of potatoes (spices,chop onions) was very good. They offer gourmet cookies and other pastries. All the prices are on par with other higher end restaurants. The quality of the food here is well worth it. The employees are great especially Claudia.
Great place !

Extremely pleasant and quiet cafe. I would definitely recommend getting any of the pastries as they are baked in house from a Culinary Institute of America French trained pastry chef. The coffee was absolutely horrendous, I would recommend bringing coffee from elsewhere and getting your pastries from here. Also side note, the WiFi did not work while I was there...
Unique menu, upscale cafe, & convenient location. Macaroons were great! Will definitely visit again.
That's the way you do it folks.  Fresh, real, food.  Great job folks!  J' ne parle francais but you make moi Cava tres bien! ❤🥐☕
Nice clean trendy place

I can not say enough good things about this gem of a french style restaurant.  The service was great. Just a young kid but he was so helpful and pleasant. I am not an easily impressed individual when it comes to food. I've traveled the world and have eaten some amazing foods in Italy and france. I ordered 5 macaroons (for $11.50 I think) which at 1st I thought was a.little pricey...until I tasted them. Before we left I ended up buying 5 more. We could nt get enough they were devine. Then we ordered the eggs Benedict  that comes on a croissant with thick cut bacon and thin sliced ham and choice of side fruit or potato. I am an egg Benedict SNOB I must confess. Like I said it's super hard to impress me. We were in heaven. We would've paid twice what the plate actually cost  (which was only $9.45 I think). I couldnt get enough. I was so happy I wanted to hug the chef. I tipped the young kid who took our order bc I was so happy and he was so chipper and helpful. The menu is smallish but that's a European thing...keep the menu small so you can make everything to perfection. And they did. I will be bringing everyone I know to breakfast, brunch and lunch here as often as I can afford. I'm their new biggest fan. And bc they haven't been open that long it's still a well kept secret so it wasn't busy at all. The food came out within 10 mins of us sitting down. I was in shock. #monami  #doingitright
Not fancy, but friendly, efficient staff & great food.
I truly enjoyed this place! The employees here were very friendly and the service was quick. I personally enjoyed my meal as it was very tasty. The place itself was clean and it had a beautiful view.

I’ve ordered from Mon Ami several times since they’ve opened and I’ve had really good food each and every time, however, today we ordered a blueberry crepe (which was a square of uncooked crepe and blueberries, nothing else) for $10..I don’t know if somebody forgot to cook it but it wasn’t good..didn’t look good or taste good and was extremely expensive for what I got..maybe a little creamy something inside with the blueberries would be nice!!

I went here for a Sunday brunch. To my delight, I had a wonderful time in the tasteful and modern atmosphere! The tart was sublime along with the french press coffee. It was a beautiful balance of butter, sweet and sour. The service was also exceptional and affable to the point that I am bringing my surgical group for morning conference. I hope the experience remains at the current fair price point for many blue moons toward the future.
Delicious and different. Cute Place to eat and tastes great!
Pretty good food. Great pastries!!
Staff is friendly, food is great. A nice Parisian style getaway in the city!
Great place
Good food, pricy pastries

Great little cafe! Beautiful clean, bright, inviting atmosphere with delicious food. Gluten free crepes are available. Parisian eggs Benedict was amazing- perfectly poached eggs, creamy hollandaise, on a flaky croissant.
Very tasty food, would recommend it, place to go back to

This place is so amazing, I was in town for a couple of days and a friend recommended this place to me. The menu here is outstanding and even for a picky eater you will satisfy your breakfast or lunch craving. Im a big fan of breakfast sandwiches and told the young lady at the register to get me the most popular breakfast sandwich. It was amazing cant wait to come back to town and    go back for another breakfast or lunch at Mon Ami.
Great sandwiches, fair prices
Awesome menu and staff!

Great place too enjoy a cup of coffee with a spectacular macaron. When I go to Mon Ami I feel like I am back in Paris. Will definitely visit again in the future and will reccomend to family and friends. Thank you Mon Ami for a wonderful experience!!!!!

I must admit that the food I had here was beyond exceptional! Despite being super busy, the staff were polite, attentive and very prompt with our order. Our pastries were very tasty, and good value, and the vanilla latte was outstanding.  Mon Ami delivers in spades, we came out of there sounding like a couple of paid shills advertising the shop!
Best espresso in the city by far!!!! Great customer service and overall great experience definitely recommend!!!
Great atmosphere! Even better food!
Excellent, restaurant quality soups, sandwiches, and salads in a counter order format. Fresh, clean dining area and fast, friendly service.  Gets pretty busy during the weekday lunch hour.

Went for lunch today. Had a salad that cost $9.00. The portion was small and the ingredients too minimal to justify that price. Mixed greens with some walnuts, raisins and small pieces of swiss cheese. There was supposed to be apples but none on my plate. The coffee was good. Was not busy for a new place.
Great food, better atmosphere. Reasonable prices. Highly recommended!
(Translated by Google) Amazing! Impressive!  (Original) Amazing! Impressionnant!
Perfectly executed French-bakery! This restaurant has become my go-to spot downtown Buffalo for breakfast and lunch -  A must visit in beautiful bustling downtown Buffalo
Solid breakfast bowl. Would have like a bit more egg and a little less potato though!

Ordered a Chi Pear Scone and a caramel macchiato when they first first opened. Both were served reasonably quick. The scone was clearly fresh baked, it was very flaky but the chi glaze on top really held it together.  The space is huge, gorgeous wood floors and reclaimed wood table tops. Plenty of seating around the location.  Staff was friendly and helpful, presentation of already prepared food was excellent.

Went there today for their grand opening. Had their chai pear scone which was buttery and flaky. The inside of the place was very clean and beautifully designed. The staff was nice and accepting of my various questions. Asked and they do all their baking on site multiple times throughout the day. Prices are standard for a bakery. Would recommend checking it out

Everyone told us to go here and I am glad we did. Stopped in for a mid-day coffee and cake. Service was very quick and friendly and the food/drink was tasty. Of course everyone said to go for the ambiance and I agree, definitely a beautiful cafe and a must visit. Must visit cafe in Buffalo.
Very great food and very comfortable, neat and clean place. I recommend this resterant to everyone.
